column4: hidek, i'm copying 1Tb to 1Tb over dd, it's REALLY slow, how do i make it faster?
are the two files on the same filesystem?
1TB takes a LOOOOOOONG time to copy
considering even the fastest SATA drives work at 6GB/s
why are you using dd and not something higher level like rsync?
you get no checks on corruption there, though
what good is the transfer if it's corrupted?
I don't think it;s a good idea, i'm doing 2 drives... they're in LVM and there's a folder that breaches across both drives (1.5tb) so i don't htink rsync can help me there
wait, so both drives are physical volumes of the same volume group?
that's what LVM is good for isn't it?
yeah, that's fine, until you need to migrate data off one pv
what are you trying to do, again?
give me something higher level than that
exactly copy what's on one set to 1Tb drives to another
i'm going to make a mdadm array
and I need to back up the drives before I put them in
